text:
He walked quickly, avoiding gazes. 

“Good heavens! My hat!” he cursed silently. 

A clock struck ten past seven. 

He needed to hurry. 

Thoughts drifted. 

He imagined fountains, their coolness refreshing the air. 

“Extend the summer garden to the field of Mars,” he mused. 

Why do people live in dirt and smell? 

He remembered the Hay Market, then shook his head. 

“What nonsense!” 

“Better think of nothing at all!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The protagonist is overwhelmed by his circumstances and reflects on his thoughts and distractions as he approaches a significant location.
